Angsana Laguna Phuket Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 973 reviews

Angsana is a beautiful resort in Laguna Phuket. Ideal for couples wanting a relaxing break. We travelled with 2 young children (19months and 9 months).

Our room was slightly disappointing as it looked like one of the older rooms on the resort. It was located about 10min walk from the pool and kids club and even further to the beach. This was an effort each day with 2 small children. The room was decorated with dark wooden/glass/marble furniture which caused several problems for young children. We had to move the glass top from the table and move one of the chairs due to its sharp edges. However this did not stop my son from cutting his chin on it when he slipped. The kids club had two climbing frames and an indoor soft play. Our children loved these but again they were a bit dated with some equipment broken and gaps in the rubber protective mats which lead to several falls. These need to be replaced. the staff at the kids club were helpful and engaged with the children in their care. The resort is clean, several swimming pools, plenty of sunbeds, direct access to beach, several restaurants and beach club. The resort was older looking than the photos suggest. There are a lot of stairs around the reception area which were not accessible with a stroller or pram. If staying at Angsana look closely at the resort map and choose a room close to the amenities. The quality of the food in the restaurants was excellent although the pool side bar was variable, as was the service there. Service in all other restaurants was excellent. If staying there note that kids eat free when an adult is ordering from the main menu, this is not advertised onsite. There wasn't a great deal of information provided on deals/offers/events happening in and around the hotel. Shuttle buses run throughout the resort connecting to other hotels and facilities. Shuttle boats connect within the Angsana resort which help to get around although the timings of these was indifferent as we waited 50min on one

Show more
Steven , United Kingdom
Sleep with Me Hotel Design Hotel at Patong
8.4 Excellent
Based on 3376 reviews

First of all, I don't have qualms about the hotel - the location is perfect, it is affordable, the room is really clean.

My bad experience happened due to a mistake (which I felt should not have been made AT ALL) by the housekeeping team. I only stayed for a night and the next morning, at about 5.45am, I heard my door open (yes that's right, not kidding) and confused and shocked, I woke up. Then I saw a shadow and asked "Who is there?!" and of course no one answered and that person left the room. The lights were all switched on (not by me). My heart beat a little faster, panic and confusion in my head. Quickly I got up, checked my belongings, and all is fine. However, due to the state of mind I'm in, I was obviously wide awake and could not get back to sleep. I then called the receptionist and he said that the housekeeping team entered the wrong room and it was a mistake. I get that it is a mistake, but this mistake is one of those that should not happen at all. This mistake seemingly compromises the safety of the traveler (and the hotel) and I was alone, which made it worse. I wasn't satisfied with what the receptionist told me so I went down and spoke to the manager. The manager offered to let me stay in the room until 6pm (my flight was at night), so that was a nice gesture. He also said that the housekeeping manager will get the man who entered my room by mistake to apologise personally, but alas, that did not happen at all. Like I said at the start, this hotel is good for what it has to offer. If I did not experience that incident, I would definitely stay in the hotel again if I'm in Phuket. But due to this, I doubt I will.

Show more
Syuhaida , Singapore
MAI HOUSE Patong Hill
9 Excellent
Based on 240 reviews

We booked Mai House just two weeks before our trip, an impromptu decision to spend our marriage engagement anniversary overseas.

No regrets - Mai House was beautiful, quaint and with excellent service from arrival to departure. Upon arrival, Pond warmly welcomed us to the hotel and checked on our preference for alcoholic drinks, to which we informed that we preferred non-alcoholic drinks. We then sat at Opium Den (the causal dining restaurant in the hotel), where we were asked for our welcome drink preference. The welcome drink, which was usually the usual coffee, tea or beer, was as open even to juices which allowed us to get a wonderful chilled watermelon shake to start our trip right. Pond came back shortly after we finished our drinks to show us our rooms. We later realised the question why the question on alcoholic preference was... they were sweetly providing us a bottle of wine in our room for our anniversary, and our dietary preference was well-noted by providing us a bottle of sparkling juice instead. So kind! They even did up our room with a beautiful pair of swans on a heart-shaped towel arrangement that we couldn't bare to take apart throughout our stay. :) The room was large, spacious and with a great view of Phuket city. We were even pointed out that the big TV was where Junceylon is. Under us was a gorgeous forest, which we love. All basic amenities were provided and even body lotion (much needed after all the sun) and a sewing kit which was super useful to us. In the closet were beach towels and even a beach bag that I saw many visitors using on their trips to Patong Beach. In the hotel, a traditional robe was provided and it was very cute seeing fellow visitors wearing it around the hotel. Oh, there is also a golf umbrella (hugeee) which was useful as it rained a few times while we were there. Love the free mini-bar even though we don't take any of the soft drinks or beer provided, cause it showed how the ladies taking care of our room were obse

Show more
Li , Singapore
The Bliss Hotel South Beach Patong
7.9 Very good
Based on 1477 reviews

The Bliss is on the South end of Patong Beach (the beach runs North - South), and is out of the way from the hustle and bustle of the rest of the touristy areas.

It is within walking distance to many of the Soi's with restaraunts and eateries, and even a short 10-12min straight walk from the party areas of Bangla Road. My wife and I liked being a little removed from the scene... This was our 1st time in Phuket/Patong...we wanted to stay closer to the likes of Kata/Karon beach for daytime chill, and still close enough to Center Patong for nighttime fun. Just note that Phuket has standard rates, so even though you're to the south and closer to Kata/Karon beaches...it's still a flat rate for TutTutt's and taxi's traveling around. The room was great and clean, it did have a great view; however, it can be a little blocked by the electric wires that line the street (pretty typical of SE Asia though). Also pretty typical was a hard bed... The room did have a hot water heater for coffee/tea, and the staff was very polite and helpful. Breakfast was delightful, changing everyday (we were the for 3 days) of different Thai tastes and a standard compliment of fruits and breads/toasts, and western breakfast items. Great stay if you like being a little removed... maybe look closer to Bangla or the center of the beach if you're looking for more of a party scene. We throughly enjoyed it, thanks for a great stay!

Show more
Juan , United States
The Royal Paradise Hotel & Spa
7.7 Very good
Based on 4983 reviews

Although we requested a non smoking room the room we were first given reeked of cigarettes. We didn't even enter the room, the smell from the door was enough.

We were given an upgraded room for one night than both parties (2 rooms) were moved to a different floor the next day. Not the best start. The biggest let down was the cleaning staff. It was Not dirty but almost every day we had to ask for something. Toilet paper, towels, water etc. In saying that, they attended to each request quickly. The safe in our room kept losing a battery. Not major but it became annoying by the end of our stay. We stayed in the tower (paradise) wing. The rooms are quite boring but adequate, not quite in keeping with the lobby which was spacious & well kept. The balcony is really, really small. You could probably just fit 2 chairs on it if there had been any. The view from it, however, is lovely, especially at sunset. (Even number - odd numbers get water and pool view. Still really nice.) Breakfast was amazing. There was so much to choose from, both western & eastern foods. To the left at the top of stairs to breakfast room is a reading nook with free books plus a couple of computers. Outside this area is a quiet undercover table & chairs spot that we used to play card games. The Royal Wing appears much newer but I don't know what the inside of the rooms are like. They may get more noise though as they are close to a busy bar/nightclub street. We could faintly hear music as we settled at night but it was never loud enough to keep us awake. The pool & gardens were clean but I found the tile steps into the pool were a bit slippery. We had lunch by the pool a couple of times & the food was hot, fresh & tasty. Overall I would stay here again & would recommend it, but it was just a few little things that stopped it from being a great 4 star hotel experience. Nothing that ruined our holiday though

Show more
Vickie , Australia
SALA Phuket Resort and Spa
8.5 Excellent
Based on 1029 reviews

Initial Impressions of the hotel was poor ; reception area was pretty ; check in was atypical of most resorts , a drink and sofa seating area that seems poorly maintained After we checked in to our first villa number 63 ; the feeling evaporated .

..partner and I felt this was an overrated resort ; The pool was dirty with rust marks ; tiles on wall were poorly marked with brown stains and also the room condition didn't make it feel like it was worth is tag of USD$250 per night We knew right away it was a mistake and called the hotel reception to change a room and was told the room will be easy after 3pm We decided to go for lunch and the food was unimpressive ...we both lived in Thailand and for 450 baht a dish ...the taste and presentation was poor for value for money. For first time visitors to Thailand they may not feel this way , coming off the Hansar Hotel in Bangkok this just felt poor and really unimpressive The total bill was 1300 baht and we never stinge on good food and we walked away thinking we need options out of this hotel After changing to villa 66 , it was in a better condition and we decided to stay for the night instead of moving to Aleenta Breakfast was good and while we were out strolling outside for dinner options , we found a string of local restaurants and like the rest of the reviews was a better option than the hotel We ate at Wansuk restaurant and this was the best seafood for the stretch of restaurants there and they even do delivery ...we needed up calling them for lunch and dinner the next day and stuffed ourselves silly with crabs and shrimps and all sorts and paid almost 5000 baht to them for the meals and compared to the in room dining options presented by Sala this was better value and so much more delicious Saving grace was we both enjoyed breakfast options and unfortunately we will not be back

Show more
Lawrence , Singapore
Paripas Patong Resort
8.3 Excellent
Based on 419 reviews

The resort is pretty new and the staffs are friendly. Breakfast was nothing to shout about but overall it's value for money.

Location is just a few mins from Hard Rock Cafe along the road, this is at least 10-12 mins walk to Bangla or Junceylon. A little far but you get to look at what the shops can offer along the way. Loved the roof top pool but it's not very big. You get a fantastic view of the mountains and sunset. The resort Is also 5-8mins to the beach. Overall location is not a big problem. Stayed in a grand suite but only thing is that the air on compressor is located right out on the balcony. It's a big Daikin compressor (industrial type) and the sound is pretty loud once the compressor kicks in. For light sleepers , you may have to wear earplugs. But the air condition is powerful enough to cool the room within 5 mins. They also charge a deposit of $200 baht for an additional key card. (Provided only one) this is a strange practice but 200b is not an issue. Overall 7.5/10

Show more
Solomon , Singapore
Best Western Patong Beach Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 699 reviews

It's probably easier to list all the things wrong: • Agoda booking confirmation started check in was from midday.

Room was not ready until 2pm, that is fine but reception staff failed to acknowledge that they were misinforming guests on one of largest booking websites • Asked to wait by pool until was ready, went to pool and this has been shut for the last 2 days, apprently no one on reception knew this. Asked to sit in bar and restuarant and was told this was also shut. Where did they want us to wait, no where to sit. • Bed sheets and pillows had dirty marks, as if had been dragged on floor. Housekeeping had to come change. • Room was for 3 guests, and we had an extra bed. Towels only for 2 guests. • When 3rd guest checked in, receptionist said reservation was only for 2 guests and would not let guest check in even though they already knew when we checked in previously and had already put the extra bed in room. Provided receptionist with confirmation and still did not believe us. Extremely rude receptionist. • On check out, spoke to Reception Manager about above issues. Told me just to send him an email. Reception not even busy and I was the only guest here. Failed to acknowledge any of my issues.

Show more
Annie , United Kingdom
The Bloc Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 135 reviews

A very good location, was next to a hostel for group of young people, which was very noisy at night. The delicious COFFEE CLUB was right under the building.

You should pay for the breakfast as the breakfast was provided by COFFEE CLUB. Poor water pressure, almost no hot water during bathing. Just lukewarm water. A small but nice swimming pool, a good ocean view swimming pool and THE BLOC is really closed to the Patong beach. Yet, the bar at swimming pool is newly constructed, it was not opened yet and you need to bring your own drinks to the pool and sunbathing area. On the 3rd or 4th day, my husband was on his way walking back to hotel, when there is a staff on the higher floor doing house keeping / floor cleaning at balcony and then he / she poured a bucket of dirty water onto the head and whole body of my husband. Another hotel guest witness the whole situation and did help us in complaint. The staff at the counter claimed that it was done by the construction workers (as mentioned the hotel was under lots of contruction work, so there are many workers inside the hotel). The hotel manager gave us a FREE ride to airport because of the accidient. But I guess no one would like to be showered by a whole bucket of dirty water.

Show more
PUI , Hong Kong
The Nap Patong Hotel
8.7 Excellent
Based on 4111 reviews

The location of the hotel is great ! Far enough to be quiet and peaceful from Bangla Road, but yet near enough to walk.

Anyhow Tuk Tuk ride will cost between 200 - 300 THB, 1 way. There is also a row of seafood eateries just around the corner, only at night. But in the morning, do try the Chicken Rice shop - said to be the best in Patong area. Although I much prefer the local soup noodles at the end of the street. As for the hotel, the staff are quick to reply our room reservations and accommodate my room upgrade - at a reasonable price. Despite a little "defect" in my room toilet, I was surprised that the maintenance staff attended to it immediately, even at 3am in the morning. It was a small hiccup, but the next morning they managed to resolve the issue. The rest of my stay was comfortable and enjoyed the bigger upgraded room. It would have been great if the "plunge pool" was bigger and deeper. But I guess that might serve a better purpose to family with kids. Overall I like the quiet and privacy of the room (#214). Will we come back again ? YES... Clean room, with ample number of towels provided. Toiletries are sufficient too. Thank you for the much needed relaxing holiday in Phuket...

Show more
Neng , Malaysia
Amatara Wellness Resort
8.7 Excellent
Based on 463 reviews

I generally enjoyed my stay here..quite decent value for money. I booked a nice big room with a sitting area & tub which looks out into the open sea.

.and I had my own pool. 3 good things i really loved: 1) The selection of tea/drinks from the mini bar which was free (if you book the bigger rooms) 2) the gorgerous view from the room...i wake up to a lovely view and sound of waves 3) the heavenly spa...loved it..some rooms had the seaview. 3 things i thought the resort could do better 1) fumigation/insect prevention..i had a room with a pool..but i couldnt use much as there was commando mozzies..i ended up using the big common pool. Didn't help there was a big rain one day..and the outside of my door had abt 6 millipedes and 1 snake. To be fair, it is hard for the hotel to prevent it..but still...hotel would have gotten much high points from me if it didn't happen 2) better thai food a little diappointed with the thai food..for a 5-star hotel, i have really high expectation of the thai food.. it didn't (in my view) make the 5-star cut. To be fair, it was quite cheap too (for a 5-star hotel),but I would not have minded paying more for very good thai food. (p.s. food in other restaurants ex-thai were very good) 3) moist towels for freshing up Might be good reminder for the hotel that when you provide moist towels for guest to freshen up, don't give them towels that have been kept wet for too long..a few of the towels had a mouldy smell, prolly from being kept wet for too long. On a conclusion, i think the hotel was a good stay..but i like to nitpick (as you can see..) so if you are not suport fussy..then you shld be good.

Show more
Chin , Singapore
Deevana Plaza Hotel Phuket Patong
8.4 Excellent
Based on 503 reviews

I was here with my partner some time in june. Been very busy since i got back home. I really wanted to write a proper review for Deevana plaza phuket which is why i took this long.

I wrote to the management regarding some of my requests which seem a little odd, but the hotel respects it and arranged it the way i want with a plesant surprise! Because it was to celebrate the anniversary of me and my partner, i requested for a high floor room and another weird request was to remind them to make sure the bathroom is spick and span as my partner is extremely particular about baths. And i also told the team that i do not want any deco in the room as my partner dislike it, sure enough there wasnt any! All my requests were attended to and what was more is they gave us a complimentary anniversary cake and a bottle of barcadi breezer. It wasnt extravagant stuffs but it was really the thought that counts. I was really touched by the gesture. The hotel went the extra mile to make our stay extremely pleasant. I really could not fault them for anything. Room: It is a great room size with balcony. The management was also thoughtful enough to light up some aroma oil in the bathroom which leaves a very plesant and calming scent through the whole room. The flooring was well polished and clean, bed was very comfortable. Every corner of the room is nothing but perfection. The chairs and small table in the balcony were good although it looked kinda used. But hey, the table and chairs were out there rain or shine, its only reasonable that it looked used. It didnt bother me at all cos it still serve its function. Housekeeping team made sure to clean out room daily and they were all smile despite some mess. Pool: We used their pool twice during 2 nights, its an awesome and good sized pool with jacuzzi area. Theres a swim up bar too which we didnt get to use as we went quite late. Lots of sun lounger. Only down side was the pool felt a little sandy and slippery when i sat down at

Show more
Sammie , Singapore
Patong Beach Hotel
7.9 Very good
Based on 1433 reviews

Booked a room for 2 adults 1 child. Room was to small for 3 people. Room only had a king bed. Staff suggested an extra bed for 1000 baht.

I declined cause there would be no space in the room for anything else. Had to share the king bed. My Thai wife was not with me during check in and was to come a few days later. I extended our stay a couple days and the wife was still to come. Staff made a big deal about wife not there during check in and wanted to charge 1500 baht extra. Because I was with my young daughter I wanted a legitinate Thai massage in the room one evening. They wanted to charge me 1500 baht extra for masseuse to come in. Even when this hotel doesn't offer in room massage service. Service was poor in all areas of the hotel. The pool cafe was terrible service and had to go to the counter myself evert me I needed to order food or drink.Moreover they still charge the 10% service charge. I have traveled and lived in Thailand for past 14 years. I found this hotel was the worst for taking advantage of the foreign tourist and was one of the worst for service. And because the location is good people will come anyway and I am sure they know that.

Show more
Terry , Canada
Ramada Phuket Deevana Patong
8.4 Excellent
Based on 237 reviews

This is a new hotel with all the features you expect from a Ramada hotel, a hotel chain (that until our stay here at the Patong Ramada) have all been first rate and thoroughly enjoyable.

Our room was very spacious, modern and fully functional. We did have to swap a very complicated coffee maker for a low tech common kettle but this was no issue. The hotel location is good being that it is close (but not too close) to many bars and restaurants, and the beach is within in easy walking distance. The pool and lounge area are more than adequate for a central hotel. Breakfast however was very disappointing (every day) ..... especially the one-man egg bar, which we had to queue for. Poached eggs off the counter were pre cooked and stone cold, the eggs made to order turned out to be under cooked and uneatable, as for the omelet that was very hit or miss (more miss than hit). Staffs were very friendly and helpful especially since it was our first time to Phuket. Nearby the hotel just down the street, there are many restaurants or street vendors (if you're looking for cheap, authentic and good local food) so you dont have to worry about getting lunch or dinner or even snacking on delicious street food. If you're a Muslim, you definitely do not have to worry about getting Halal food as Patong area itself offers a wide range of halal food and a lot of the street vendors are muslims so we just look out for the halal sign or those sellers wearing Hijab. All in all, our stay here was an awesome and satisfying one. Would definitely recommend it to our family and friends. We arrived at the airport around 10pm. The owner of the hotel picked us up at no charge and took us back to the hotel.

It's about five minutes away by car, so it's perfect for a late arrival or an early departure, which we also had. That trip to the airport was also complimentary. The room was clean, spacious, and comfortable, with a nice big fridge in every room. The bed and pillows were new (the whole building is new), and my back felt great the next morning. At the end of our holiday we came back to Nai Yang Place for a second night. We arrived early in the afternoon, so we rented a nice new Honda scooter from the hotel for six hours (200 baht), and headed down to Mai Khao beach. There's not much there, but that's what's so nice about it. You have a long stretch of beautiful beach, pretty much all to yourself. A thousand times nicer than the overcrowded Patong shoreline. There's also a few really cozy bamboo and thatch style restaurants on edge of the beach where you can get a nice seafood bbq and watch the sunset over the Andaman Sea. I'd highly recommend this hotel. The location is great, the rooms are great, and the service is exceptional. They really went out of their way to ensure we were happy.

Surin Sabai was a great place to stay for our first overseas trip with our 20 month old. Our two bedroom apartment was perfect - very comfortable beds, well appointed kitchen, lovely balcony and lots of space for our little boy to run around.

We arrived late and really appreciated the pre-arranged taxi from the airport and that a cot was set up ready for us. We spent lots of time in the swimming pool - compact but fine for us. There was a little bit of noise from the construction site next door, but nothing major and only really noticeable from the pool area during the day. Surin was a great location for a quiet, relaxing getaway. Worth noting that mid-year many of the restaurants are closed or don't open until 11am, so we seemed to only have one breakfast option but that was fine. Beautiful, clean beach, a little rough at high tide but never so much that our little boy couldn't play at the water's edge. Some great restaurant options on the beach for lunch and dinner - although generally not many vegetarian options. We ate at Nok's Seafood most days - lovely view and lovely staff. I generally like to try a new location for each holiday but would seriously consider going back to Surin for a family holiday and would definitely stay at Surin Sabai again.

The room was as described. I have stayed in the building many times over the years and have seen the changes take place at this condominium.

The building itself was one of the first large high-rises in Patong and is showing its age. It's a bit of a soulless concrete monolith that amplifies the ambient noise at night. The unit has been updated. It is as described. Unfortunately, the bed mattress wore out long ago and left me with a very painful back. One can feel the metal springs. Housekeeping was consistent and daily. The one major weakness was the lack of wifi access. Although one can purchase access, the room is in a dead zone and there is an intermittent signal. I basically wasted my money on the wifi pass. This isn't the rental's problem. Rather it is the condo management that has structured the wifi in this manner. It's the first time in 7 years I had a wifi problem. Overall Patong is not a good vacation destination. The beach is dirty and under the control of jet ski touts. I can't believe that they are allowed to monopolize approx. 50% of the beach. Phuket prices are much higher than other Thai locations. The taxi fare to the condo was 900 baht, which is basically 2-3X higher than equidistant locations in Thailand. That sums up Phuket. None of these issues is the rental's fault, but it is something to consider when looking at the value of a destination.

More about Phuket

Being one of Thailand's most famous islands, Phuket is positioned off the southern coast of Thailand in the Andaman Sea, featuring the golden sands, calm blue waters, and coconut palms associated with the perfect tropical vacation. Phuket Town is the island's main commercial area, and accommodation in the city center is cheap.

Phuket's most popular resort area is Patong. Fully redeveloped after the 2004 tsunami, Patong's main roads are lined with restaurants, shops, and countless bars and clubs. The nightlife here is legendary in Asia, and many book a hotel in Patong just to experience its lively after-hours scene.

South of Patong Beach is Karon Beach – a much quieter town with shops, restaurants, and bars that cater specifically to tourists. Kamala also offers a good range of accommodation and infrastructure with resorts becoming progressively more upscale towards Bang Thao, Surin, and Pansea beaches.

On the other side of the Phuket lay the islands of Koh Yao Yai, Koh Yao Noi, and Nakha Yai. Resorts on these islands assure secluded beaches and high levels of service.

Phuket is served by Phuket International Airport, about a 45-minute drive from Patong Beach and Phuket Town.

Ideal for couples wanting a relaxing break. We travelled with 2 young children (19months and 9 months). Our room was slightly disappointing as it looked like one of the older rooms on the resort. It was located about 10min walk from the pool and kids club and even further to the beach. This was an effort each day with 2 small children. The room was decorated with dark wooden/glass/marble furniture which caused several problems for young children. We had to move the glass top from the table and move one of the chairs due to its sharp edges. However this did not stop my son from cutting his chin on it when he slipped. The kids club had two climbing frames and an indoor soft play. Our children loved these but again they were a bit dated with some equipment broken and gaps in the rubber protective mats which lead to several falls. These need to be replaced. the staff at the kids club were helpful and engaged with the children in their care. The resort is clean, several swimming pools, plenty of sunbeds, direct access to beach, several restaurants and beach club. The resort was older looking than the photos suggest. There are a lot of stairs around the reception area which were not accessible with a stroller or pram. If staying at Angsana look closely at the resort map and choose a room close to the amenities. The quality of the food in the restaurants was excellent although the pool side bar was variable, as was the service there. Service in all other restaurants was excellent. If staying there note that kids eat free when an adult is ordering from the main menu, this is not advertised onsite. There wasn't a great deal of information provided on deals/offers/events happening in and around the hotel. Shuttle buses run throughout the resort connecting to other hotels and facilities. Shuttle boats connect within the Angsana resort which help to get around although the timings of these was indifferent as we waited 50min on one Show more Steven , United Kingdom Sleep with Me Hotel Design Hotel at Patong 8.4 Excellent Based on 3376 reviews First of all, I don't have qualms about the hotel - the location is perfect, it is affordable, the room is really clean. My bad experience happened due to a mistake (which I felt should not have been made AT ALL) by the housekeeping team. I only stayed for a night and the next morning, at about 5.45am, I heard my door open (yes that's right, not kidding) and confused and shocked, I woke up. Then I saw a shadow and asked "Who is there?!" and of course no one answered and that person left the room. The lights were all switched on (not by me). My heart beat a little faster, panic and confusion in my head. Quickly I got up, checked my belongings, and all is fine. However, due to the state of mind I'm in, I was obviously wide awake and could not get back to sleep. I then called the receptionist and he said that the housekeeping team entered the wrong room and it was a mistake. I get that it is a mistake, but this mistake is one of those that should not happen at all. This mistake seemingly compromises the safety of the traveler (and the hotel) and I was alone, which made it worse. I wasn't satisfied with what the receptionist told me so I went down and spoke to the manager. The manager offered to let me stay in the room until 6pm (my flight was at night), so that was a nice gesture. He also said that the housekeeping manager will get the man who entered my room by mistake to apologise personally, but alas, that did not happen at all. Like I said at the start, this hotel is good for what it has to offer. If I did not experience that incident, I would definitely stay in the hotel again if I'm in Phuket. But due to this, I doubt I will. Upon arrival, Pond warmly welcomed us to the hotel and checked on our preference for alcoholic drinks, to which we informed that we preferred non-alcoholic drinks. We then sat at Opium Den (the causal dining restaurant in the hotel), where we were asked for our welcome drink preference. The welcome drink, which was usually the usual coffee, tea or beer, was as open even to juices which allowed us to get a wonderful chilled watermelon shake to start our trip right. Pond came back shortly after we finished our drinks to show us our rooms. So kind! They even did up our room with a beautiful pair of swans on a heart-shaped towel arrangement that we couldn't bare to take apart throughout our stay. :) The room was large, spacious and with a great view of Phuket city. We were even pointed out that the big TV was where Junceylon is. Under us was a gorgeous forest, which we love. All basic amenities were provided and even body lotion (much needed after all the sun) and a sewing kit which was super useful to us. In the closet were beach towels and even a beach bag that I saw many visitors using on their trips to Patong Beach. In the hotel, a traditional robe was provided and it was very cute seeing fellow visitors wearing it around the hotel. Oh, there is also a golf umbrella (hugeee) which was useful as it rained a few times while we were there. It is within walking distance to many of the Soi's with restaraunts and eateries, and even a short 10-12min straight walk from the party areas of Bangla Road. My wife and I liked being a little removed from the scene... This was our 1st time in Phuket/Patong...we wanted to stay closer to the likes of Kata/Karon beach for daytime chill, and still close enough to Center Patong for nighttime fun. Just note that Phuket has standard rates, so even though you're to the south and closer to Kata/Karon beaches...it's still a flat rate for TutTutt's and taxi's traveling around. The room was great and clean, it did have a great view; however, it can be a little blocked by the electric wires that line the street (pretty typical of SE Asia though). Also pretty typical was a hard bed... The room did have a hot water heater for coffee/tea, and the staff was very polite and helpful. Breakfast was delightful, changing everyday (we were the for 3 days) of different Thai tastes and a standard compliment of fruits and breads/toasts, and western breakfast items. Great stay if you like being a little removed... maybe look closer to Bangla or the center of the beach if you're looking for more of a party scene. We throughly enjoyed it, thanks for a great stay! The building itself was one of the first large high-rises in Patong and is showing its age. It's a bit of a soulless concrete monolith that amplifies the ambient noise at night. The unit has been updated. It is as described. Unfortunately, the bed mattress wore out long ago and left me with a very painful back. One can feel the metal springs. Housekeeping was consistent and daily. The one major weakness was the lack of wifi access. Although one can purchase access, the room is in a dead zone and there is an intermittent signal. I basically wasted my money on the wifi pass. This isn't the rental's problem. Rather it is the condo management that has structured the wifi in this manner. It's the first time in 7 years I had a wifi problem. Overall Patong is not a good vacation destination. The beach is dirty and under the control of jet ski touts. I can't believe that they are allowed to monopolize approx. 50% of the beach. Phuket prices are much higher than other Thai locations. The taxi fare to the condo was 900 baht, which is basically 2-3X higher than equidistant locations in Thailand. That sums up Phuket. None of these issues is the rental's fault, but it is something to consider when looking at the value of a destination. Matabuena ,Philippines Discover the neighborhoods of Phuket Patong 1393 hotels Naiharn 642 hotels Bang Thao 534 hotels Phuket Town 459 hotels Kamala 435 hotels Kata 433 hotels Rawai 422 hotels Karon 322 hotels Chalong 274 hotels Surin 211 hotels Kathu 204 hotels Phuket Airport 134 hotels Paklok 112 hotels Panwa Cape 98 hotels Mai Khao 79 hotels Koh Yao Noi 59 hotels Naithon 53 hotels Naiyang 42 hotels Layan 38 hotels Thalang 37 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Apartments in Phuket 1311 Resorts in Phuket 570 Guest Houses in Phuket 443 Serviced Apartments in Phuket 134 Hostels in Phuket 113 Bungalows in Phuket 35 Motels in Phuket 3 More about Phuket Being one of Thailand's most famous islands, Phuket is positioned off the southern coast of Thailand in the Andaman Sea, featuring the golden sands, calm blue waters, and coconut palms associated with the perfect tropical vacation. Phuket Town is the island's main commercial area, and accommodation in the city center is cheap. Phuket's most popular resort area is Patong. Fully redeveloped after the 2004 tsunami, Patong's main roads are lined with restaurants, shops, and countless bars and clubs. The nightlife here is legendary in Asia, and many book a hotel in Patong just to experience its lively after-hours scene. South of Patong Beach is Karon Beach – a much quieter town with shops, restaurants, and bars that cater specifically to tourists. Kamala also offers a good range of accommodation and infrastructure with resorts becoming progressively more upscale towards Bang Thao, Surin, and Pansea beaches. On the other side of the Phuket lay the islands of Koh Yao Yai , Koh Yao Noi, and Nakha Yai. Resorts on these islands assure secluded beaches and high levels of service. Phuket is served by Phuket International Airport , about a 45-minute drive from Patong Beach and Phuket Town.
